column4: candrodor: afaik, all drives are unmounted automatically on shutdown, so there is really no need to bother for a normal user...
Seems so, check out crunchbang, a ubuntu derivative which uses it.
I don't want another bloated ubuntu clone ... I wanna build my minimal install
crunchbang is normally far less bloated than ubuntu, but you could always check it out just to evaluate openbox, and then go ahead with the minimal+openbox if it suits you...
